title: Data-driven Mathematics Education Design Using Quantitative Content Analysis Methodology

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Mathematical Concepts and Experience with Digital Learning Tools
context.additional_context: A practice-focused training program utilizing VR simulations in a smartphone-centric, technology-constrained environment.

learning_goals: Learners can conduct quantitative analysis of mathematics educational content by applying the DCAM (Defining-Coding-Analyzing-Modeling) methodology.
Learners can define variables in mathematical problem-solving processes and apply reliability measurements using nominal/ordinal/scale-based coding techniques.
Learners can identify patterns in simulation-based learning data and derive educational insights through non-parametric statistical analysis.

resources: Pre-Produced VR Simulation Content for Mathematics Education
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
